quotes.quote: Whoever possessed knowledge not only had power over the changeable passions of people, but also power over their thinking, over their minds, hearts and souls.
He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
The possession of anything begins in the mind.
The most luxurious possession, the richest treasure anybody has, is his personal dignity.
The desire for possession is insatiable, to such a point that it can survive even love itself. To love, therefore, is to sterelize the person one loves.
Possession isn't nine-tenths of the law. It's nine-tenths of the problem.
Possessions are mere transient effects that come when they are required, and after their purpose has been served, pass away.
Some men are born to own; can animate all their possessions. Others cannot; Their owning is not graceful; seems to be a compromise of their character; they seem to steal their own dividends.
The greatest treasure in life is the possession of time.
The things you own end up owning you.
Nothing can be so perfect while we possess it as it will seem when remembered.
Possession hinders enjoyment. It merely gives you the right to keep things for or from others, and thus you gain more enemies than friends.
The possession of land seems to be a greater gratification to the pride and independence of men.
There is, of course, a difference between what a man seizes and what he really possesses.
Gentleness, self-sacrifice and generosity are the exclusive possession of no one race or religion.
He that sets not his heart on what he possesses, forsaketh all things, though he keep his possessions.
Fifty percent of something is better than one hundred percent of nothing.
Each possession I own is but a stone around my neck.

What is it about possessing things? Why do we feel the need to own what we love? And why do we become such jerks when we do? We've all been there. You want something, you possess it - and by possessing it, you lose it.
People who have few possessions cling tightly to those they have. That is one of the facts that make life so discouraging.
Possession without obligation to the object possessed approaches felicity.
We do not attach ourselves permanently to any possessions, excepting in proportion to the trouble, toil and longing which they have cost us.
It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.
Much of human history has consisted of unequal conflicts between the haves and the have-nots.
The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
Why grab possessions like thieves, or divide them like socialists, when you can ignore them like wise men?
Possessions are usually diminished by possession.
The wavering mind is but a base possession.
Complete possession is proved only by giving. All you are unable to give possesses you.
There is one possession that can never be taken away as long as you will not allow it to be taken, and that is your word.
